data.title: 10 Best Dangelo Songs of All Time

data.meta_site_name: Singersroom.com - R&B Music, R&B Videos, R&B News
data.text:
D’Angelo is an American singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist renowned for his contributions to the neo-soul genre. Born Michael Eugene Archer on February 11, 1974, in Richmond, Virginia, he gained acclaim with his debut album, *Brown Sugar* (1995), which featured a blend of soul, R&B, and funk influences. His follow-up, *Voodoo* (2000), is often hailed as a masterpiece of modern soul, showcasing his rich, smooth vocals and innovative production. After a long hiatus, he released *Black Messiah* (2014), a critically acclaimed album that addressed contemporary social issues. D’Angelo’s music is celebrated for its depth, complexity, and authenticity.

1. Untitled (How Does It Feel)

“Untitled (How Does It Feel)” is a standout track from D’Angelo’s 2000 album *Voodoo*. Known for its smooth, sensual vibe and innovative production, the song is a quintessential example of neo-soul. It features D’Angelo’s rich, emotive vocals, backed by a minimalist groove and soulful instrumentation. The track is renowned for its raw, unfiltered expression of desire and intimacy, highlighted by its extended, soulful instrumental sections and sultry lyrics. The accompanying music video, which features D’Angelo performing the song shirtless, further emphasizes the track’s intimate and seductive quality. “Untitled (How Does It Feel)” is widely regarded as one of D’Angelo’s most iconic songs and a defining moment in neo-soul music.

2. Brown Sugar

“Brown Sugar” is the title track from D’Angelo’s debut album, released on July 3, 1995. The song is a smooth, soulful blend of R&B and funk, featuring D’Angelo’s distinctive, velvety vocals and a groove-driven instrumental. The track explores themes of romance and sensuality, characterized by its laid-back rhythm and sultry lyrics. “Brown Sugar” helped establish D’Angelo as a major figure in the neo-soul movement, showcasing his ability to blend classic soul influences with contemporary sounds. The song and album received critical acclaim for their innovative approach and contributed significantly to the neo-soul genre’s emergence.

3. Lady

“Lady” by D’Angelo is a soulful track from his 1995 debut album *Brown Sugar*. Written by D’Angelo, along with his brother, and produced by D’Angelo and Bob Power, the song features a smooth, laid-back groove and D’Angelo’s distinctive falsetto vocals. The lyrics express deep affection and appreciation for a romantic partner, blending themes of love and devotion with a sensual and intimate delivery. “Lady” received critical acclaim for its soulful melody and D’Angelo’s emotive performance, becoming one of the standout tracks on *Brown Sugar* and solidifying his reputation in the neo-soul genre.

4. Devil’s Pie

“Devil’s Pie” by D’Angelo is a track from his 2000 album *Voodoo*. The song features a distinctive blend of neo-soul, funk, and R&B, with a gritty, atmospheric production. Written by D’Angelo, along with his brother and producer Raphael Saadiq, the track combines a deep, soulful groove with reflective and socially conscious lyrics. “Devil’s Pie” explores themes of temptation, corruption, and personal struggle, reflecting D’Angelo’s introspective and emotionally resonant songwriting. The song is notable for its rich instrumentation, D’Angelo’s expressive vocal performance, and its critical commentary on societal issues.

5. Cruisin’

“Cruisin’” is a track from D’Angelo’s debut album, *Brown Sugar*, released in 1995. This song is a smooth, mellow cover of the 1979 hit by Smokey Robinson. D’Angelo’s rendition retains the original’s soulful essence while adding his unique, contemporary touch. The track features his rich vocals over a laid-back groove, with lush instrumentation that complements the song’s relaxed, romantic feel. “Cruisin’” highlights D’Angelo’s ability to reinterpret classic soul and R&B songs with a modern twist, further establishing his reputation as a talented and innovative artist in the neo-soul genre.

6. Send It On

“Send It On” is a song by D’Angelo from his 2000 album *Voodoo*. The track features a smooth, soulful sound with elements of funk and R&B, showcasing D’Angelo’s distinctive falsetto and emotive delivery. The lyrics address themes of love and communication, urging the listener to express their feelings and share their emotions. The song’s mellow, laid-back groove and heartfelt performance make it a standout track on the album, reflecting D’Angelo’s ability to blend deep, introspective lyrics with a rich, musical sound. “Send It On” contributes to the album’s critical acclaim and D’Angelo’s reputation as a leading figure in neo-soul.

7. Left & Right

“Left & Right” is a track from D’Angelo’s 2000 album *Voodoo*. The song features a smooth, funk-infused groove with a laid-back, soulful vibe. It showcases D’Angelo’s signature style, blending rich vocals with a rhythmic, groove-driven instrumental arrangement. The track includes a memorable chorus and highlights the album’s overall exploration of sensuality and emotional depth. “Left & Right” exemplifies D’Angelo’s ability to merge classic soul influences with contemporary sounds, contributing to the album’s critical acclaim and cementing his status as a leading figure in neo-soul.

8. Unshaken

“Unshaken” by D’Angelo is a track from the 2018 soundtrack album *Red Dead Redemption 2: Original Score*. The song features D’Angelo’s signature soulful vocals and a laid-back, atmospheric production that fits the game’s evocative and immersive setting. Written by D’Angelo and produced by him alongside Mark Anthony Anthony, “Unshaken” combines elements of soul and folk with a reflective, introspective mood. The lyrics and instrumentation convey a sense of resilience and inner strength, resonating with the themes of the game. “Unshaken” received praise for its hauntingly beautiful sound and its contribution to the game’s emotional depth.

9. Feel Like Makin’ Love

“Feel Like Makin’ Love” is a classic R&B song originally recorded by Roberta Flack in 1974. The track features a smooth, romantic vibe with Flack’s soulful vocals paired with a mellow instrumental arrangement. The song’s lyrics express deep affection and desire, capturing a sense of intimate connection and emotional depth. It became one of Flack’s signature songs and remains a timeless example of her influential style. The song’s blend of heartfelt lyrics and soothing melody has made it a favorite among fans of soul and R&B music.

10. Spanish Joint

“Spanish Joint” by D’Angelo is a track from his 2000 album *Voodoo*. The song features a blend of soulful vocals, intricate instrumentation, and a laid-back groove with Latin influences. It showcases D’Angelo’s ability to combine elements of funk, jazz, and R&B with a smooth, immersive production. The track’s sultry rhythm and expressive lyrics create a rich, atmospheric sound that highlights D’Angelo’s signature style. “Spanish Joint” is praised for its sophisticated musical arrangement and D’Angelo’s emotive performance, making it a standout on the *Voodoo* album and a favorite among fans of neo-soul.
